Key Match Events: Iceland won 2-0 against Montenegro with goals from Oskarsson (39') and Dagur Thorsteinsson (58')
Pre-Game Insights: Iceland will be aiming to start their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign with a victory when they welcome Montenegro in Group 4 of League B on Friday night.

Our Boys will be hoping to put together a strong qualification campaign for the 2026 World Cup, but their immediate attention will be on the Nations League, as they prepare to take on Montenegro, Turkey and Wales in this particular section.
The Brave Falcons will welcome Wales in their second match in Group 4 of League B on September 9, before returning to action in October with fixtures against Turkey and Wales.
Post-Match Reflections: Iceland's head coach Hareide did not spring any real surprises when it came to his squad for the team's next two matches, and it is expected to be a recognisable starting side for Friday's contest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iceland, as mentioned, finished second in Group 2 of League B in their last Nations League campaign, drawing all four of their matches against Israel and Albania.

Montenegro finished third in their qualification section for Euro 2024, with the team therefore absent from the finals of the recent European Championship, while they have also never qualified for a World Cup.
